sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The few remaining residents of the Ukrainian city of Bakhmut are struggling to survive in the mists of the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The front lines have not moved much in recent weeks, and Kyiv is hoping that new weapons promised by the West will tip the balance in its favor.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: On the Kherson front, Ukrainian soldiers train while searching for a new way to cross the Dnipro river without suffering excessive casualties.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The newly elected Czech president, a former NATO general, is calling on Ukraine allies to do more.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And now the question of sending fighter jets has entered the debate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: It's easy to sort of get carried away and, you know, last week we gave tanks and what next can we promise?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: There are things to promise next and, you know, I've said in the Chamber of the House of Commons I'm very open to examining all sorts of systems and not just jets to give Ukraine that assistance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: But these things don't always happen overnight.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, Ukrainian authorities are cracking down on corruption within agencies managing funds intended to assist victims of war. In Odessa, several officials have been arrested for defrauding the state of nearly 175,000 euros. Kyiv knows it needs to reassure donors that the money they give is going to the intended recipients.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: A highly symbolic visit, showing off Europe's commitment to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Ursula von der Leyen, the European Commission president in Kiev, once again meeting the Ukrainian president Volodymyr Zelensky.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But this time, she's not alone. No less than 15 European Commissioners have joined her for various meetings with the Ukrainian government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: All this despite the fact that the country is still at war. Meeting this gathering and these pictures will go down in the history. But beyond the symbolism, President Zelenskyy wants the European Union to introduce more sanctions against Russia, as he thinks they're, quote, slowing down.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We will introduce with our G7 partners an additional price cap on Russian petroleum products. And by the 24th of February, exactly one year since the invasion started, we aim to have the 10th package of sanctions in place. Also on the table, how to promote the integration of Ukraine into the EU. But Kiev's hope for quick membership was frustrated, as there's no agreements between member states for a fast-track procedure. They say more work must be done.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Ukraine says it will continue fighting against corruption.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: While EU commissioners were meeting with Ukrainian ministers, the EU Foreign Affairs Chief Joseph Borre was with the Prime Minister, promising to double the number of Ukrainian soldiers to be trained, as well as campaigning to deactivate mines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: On Friday, the visit continues with an EU-Ukraine summit.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Our Sasha Vakuliny has more. Ukrainian authorities insisted that the EU-Ukraine summit should take place here in Kyiv and not in Brussels. They wanted the delegation of senior EU officials to see how the country is operating, how they're introducing measures and requirements, whilst at the same time defending itself for almost one year now. Something that Kyiv certainly believes deserves the EU membership. Sasha Vakulina, Euronews, Kyiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The Russian president laid a wreath to mark the 80th anniversary of the Soviet victory over the Nazis in the battle of Stalingrad.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Putin placed it below the Eternal Flame, which is part of the memorial complex in the city now known as Volgograd.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: He used his speech to draw parallels with the war in Ukraine. We don't send our tanks to their borders.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But we have something to answer.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And using armored vehicles will not end the case.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Everyone should understand this.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The five-month battle of Stalingrad is regarded as the bloodiest battle in history, with an estimated two million soldiers and civilians dying.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The Nazis razed most of the city to the ground before surrendering on the 2nd February 1943.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: This was a major turning point in the Second World War, and the victory remains a source of great pride in modern Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: A feeling the Kremlin wants to weaponize.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Kosovo has signaled that it's willing to create an association of five Serb-majority municipalities in the north of the country in order to unblock talks with Belgrade. Critics say it could give Serbia a permanent hand in Kosovo's politics, But it's a key part of a 2013 deal to eventually normalize relations between the two countries. Serbia's president, Aleksandar Vucic, has urged lawmakers in Belgrade to accept the diplomatic moves.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Would we become a European pariah? Yes, we would. Completely isolated. No one would talk to us. We would not have any access to funds. You cannot function in the modern world alone.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: However, Serbian nationalists consider any move towards the recognition of Kosovo's independence unacceptable and have made their anger known to Vucic in Parliament.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Several dozen people also demonstrated in Belgrade against any political understanding being struck with Pristina.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: I'm sitting in my driveway here in Billings, Montana and right now there is a ground stop on our airport and this thing is up in the sky.
